Posts.Content: Oct 6, 2009 10:21PM DiDiT wrote: I too think sometimes people really just don't know what to say, I  have a dear friend, one of my best friends who really was the worst - I could tell she was asking very specific questions, so she could just repeat what she knew to everyone else - but she also wanted to know if I was going to be ok,  I didn't know myself, and if I had gotten a poor prognosis, I don't think I would have told her.  I know in my heart that she is concerned so I feel bad for being annoyed by her 'coping tactics' - I'm trying to consider the source and the underlying sentiment that's there - I've actually not spent much time with her through this -  And then my 'little brother' a year younger than I - who calls frequently to check on me - didn't know what a mastectomy was and asked me - I replied 'breast removal' - he then wanted to make sure I'd be getting 'fake ones'  and commented that 'Glen (my dh) must be happy about that' I know he didn't mean anything by that - he lives several states away - most people who don't live with you - if they have no experience with this, they have no idea what we're going through - the side effects, the fear, the EVERYTHING!   I've been so good at 'being good' mainly so that those that I love don't suffer - that's what works for me... It's nice then to visit these threads and hear from others in 'same boat' and feel a tie - I save that for here.  And with my close friends and family, if they ask, I share some specifics, otherwise,  I'm living my life, functioning with my family and carrying out routines as normally as possible.  Here's to coping in different ways!
Posts.Title: Cannot believe what the neighbor said... Ang7 Shanagirl

Posts.Content: Feb 8, 2010 09:51PM DiDiT wrote: Are you all pretty sure the joint pain is from the Taxol?  I didn't have these symptoms during chemo. I'm over 2 months out and OMG - my hips and knees are killing me!!!  If I sit for very long, can hardly get out of chair and then can barely walk...And knees so bad not able to kneel, squat at all - this just seemed to have come on within the last couple weeks.. I read here somewhere that some have been treated for fibromyalgia.  My onco doesn't seem to think this is chemo related - HELLO, I was quite flexible and very active prior to chemo, in fact,  we had planned on ice skating and snow skiing this long weekend, since I'm unable to retrieve pretzels from the bottom shelf at wal mart independently - sure I'm not a candidate for resuming pre-chemo activity just yet!!!!! Ooh, it sounds like I'm griping - looking for advice, I thought about glucosamine for the joints, but since  I don't really know why paining - don't know if that would help:{
Posts.Title: How long body aches last after Taxol pinkribbongirl pinkribbongirl

Posts.Content: Oct 17, 2009 08:21AM - edited Oct 17, 2009 08:23AM by DiDiT Polly, I asked onc for lasix this wk -   She reluctantly gave me 5 - said I could try, but only if my bp was over 100 - I usually run low.  Took the lasix only 2 days, and have felt MUCH better this week!!   In fact, this week I feel NORMAL - I've been running all day every day with appts., work, kids, etc. I'm noticing slight numbness & tingling periodically in my pointer fingers and thumbs - hoping this doesn't progress! Don't know about post treatment scans, but my insurance pays 100% for dx test.  I didn't have to get the PET pre certified.   What's the difference of getting a mammogram yearly when you have no symptoms before cancer vs MRI and bone scans post - as it's common knowledge that bc -   if it were to come back would commonly be lung, bone, or brain.   I would like to believe that I'll have 'NO CANCER' after chemo, surgery, etc. , but does your doctor know for certain that there are no lingering cells anywhere? -    I'm not there yet, but it seems there are many on here that mention the routine scans following treatment - sounds like the norm. I'm regretting not being more persistent in the past with this 'fibrocystic' thing - - ANYWAY.  Moving forward, I'm more informed and speaking up - and so far, getting what I want! Had it not been for this forum, going solely on Dr's orders, I wouldn't be getting recon w/ mx - (he wouldn't do before radiation) - For me, this is a quality issue - AND I AM SO GRATEFUL FOR FINDING YOU ALL - and that I'll have some kind of boobs this summer:)  (too shallow?)   Di Di
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Nov 1, 2009 05:55PM DiDiT wrote: Michelle - So glad to hear you're doing well!  Congrats on the implants!  Didn't know that was a possibility for you!    Also glad to hear that you could get up and toilet independently - especially the wiping part!  lol THANKS FOR  SHARING! Seriously, being sincere, not sarcastic....I'm quite independent and was already dreading the few days post op!!!!! I've only had a few surgeries, but awake heaving every time from anesthesia - I'm sure that felt nice, on top of everything else! So, in summary, I should be able to go to the bathroom by myself and take the pain meds! Thanks!!!! Of course I want to hear about those implants too... Di Di
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Nov 8, 2009 07:13PM DiDiT wrote: Diane48  - I don't think I'd say I have neuropathy...but, today, Sunday, (I have txs on Tues)  my toes were a little tingly & numb.  Only for a little while, I'm hoping hoping hoping that's about all I get, but I do have 4 more weeks to go, and I'm sure this is a cumulative effect... For some reason, I rarely have a hot flash anymore, and night sweats are pretty much gone too - weird! Polly - I hear ya with the 'appearance' thing - I really don't even want anyone to see me on Thursdays and Fridays, seems I'm the most 'puffy' then.  I didn't lose all of my lashes or brows - yet, I should say - and my hair is coming in - I think pretty even.  My head's covered - of course very short!! I don't go anywhere without makeup and jewelry - then everyone 'thinks' I 'look great'.  It's a trick!! As far as the color thing, I even got in the tanning bed the other day...I usually tan some in the winter - not a lot, just 'like a little color'  And I feel like I look yellow/pasty - yuk!  Anyway, I only stayed 10 minutes...had the fan on, tunes, and imagined I was at the beach....now that's therapy! Zuzeee - Can't imagine 5 hrs for rads, I'm whining about the 3 (round trip) that I'll have - in fact, I think I may stay over a couple nights a week - I have to balance work and family too, but really, as fast as this has gone so far, that 6 weeks will flyyyyy byyyyy!!!  And WHAT?!  WEIGHT GAIN ON RADS?!  I thought surely after these steroids, I'd start shedding some weight!  I hate that I've gained 15 lbs so far!!!!   Hugs to all!! Di Di
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Nov 12, 2009 07:42AM - edited Nov 12, 2009 07:43AM by DiDiT Polly - I hear ya!!   I have this image of what I'm going to look like laying on that gurney in the OR, no make up - fat, flabby bod, fat face, no hair to speak of - and HOPE that my BS, PS, and company still do their best to restore this part of my body , so that when the rest of me gets back in shape, I'll be ME!    I envision them taking a look at me and saying, heck, the way she looks, anything would be an improvement, let's just get it done! I know (I hope) that's not how it goes, but I feel like they don't really know me - because they didn't know me or see me before all of this!!!!! AND YES, it will be done soon!!!   For what it's worth, for some reason, both of my pinky toe nails loosened and came off early this summer, before I even knew I had the big C word - I put a little polish where they were supposed to be, until they came back in -which they did, quite normal!  I had even forgotten about that, until you mentioned losing yours....Hang Tough!!!  ONLY 3 MORE TO GO!!!   Di Di Hey, how are your counts??   My H&H was a little lower this week, WBC good -
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Sep 29, 2009 11:34PM DiDiT wrote: Polly, we're kind of on the same track with the Taxol I think.  I just rec'd tx #3 today with herceptin.  My hair started coming back in a couple weeks after my las AC dose.  I was going to shave it right away, as I too didn't want just fuzzies, but a friend of mine told me that her hair came back in while she was on taxol (she was dose densing every 2 weeks)  said her eyelashes and brows fell out but head hair continued to grow.  My head is almost covered, visible hair - I'm not liking it too much, of course it looks gray, but can't decide whether to shave it or let it grow!   Congats on your sons graduation and your being able to make the trip - I know what you mean about the 'uglys'  I'm starting to see a transformation when I look in the mirror - dark circles under eyes, puffy eyes and face - skin kind of a weird color - short sparse lashes, few straggly brows, and yet, as you say, people keep saying 'how great I look' - I'm not much of a complainer  - but these hot flashes make me want to strip off at the most inconvenient times - I'm reluctantly trying the effexor that onc ordered for the flashes and night sweats - I hate taking meds!!  But I kinda hate the hot flashes, constipation, indigestion, sleepless nights, etc, etc, etc, even more - makes it difficult to function at work.  So, I'm hitting the medicine cabinet this week - miralax, prilosec, advil PM, and effexor - I feel old and defective!! Hope all continues well with your taxol routine

Posts.Content: Dec 31, 2009 02:40PM DiDiT wrote:  Yes, 6 months, and many of you on now on to normalcy, yaayyy!!!!  I finished chemo 12/1 had bilat mx w/te's 12/18, have had 1 fill, have 2 drains that remain, AND am every day feeling more 'normal' - the chemo side effects are all but gone - Taste is back, edema gone, numbness gone - I still am packing all the weight that I gained, but can't really exercise as I'm not to use my arms at all, but you know the drill!!!   Onward and upward!!! Happy New Year to you all!!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Oct 9, 2009 11:04AM - edited Oct 9, 2009 11:04AM by DiDiT lmag, I agree w/Pam, 4 months for results - too long.  Saw 3 phys yesterday for 2nd opinion re: recon before rads and poss hysterectomy at same time as mx. Saw genetic counselor - blood drawn for BRCA testing - Can't remember what state she said it goes to, but that she'd have results within 1 - 3 weeks.  I'm not in that big of a hurry - was doing hysterectomy more because of the impending Tamoxifin,  but it will be nice to know the results, as I have two daughters age 21 and 19...  Deb - sorry you're having so much trouble w/employer!  I've considered often how much more difficult this has to be for those without insurance, family support, etc.  -  I feel totally blessed that I have all of the above, but was SHOCKED at how expensive co-payment for some of these drugs are - my portion of the weekly herceptin is $615 - my chemo nurse suggested getting online -that there's assistance even for copays.   Don't know if you've already done that, but cancercare was a nonprofit org that was reccommend - someone from the manufacturer of Herceptin called me this morning to make sure I had heard from them, then she proceeded to ask if I needed help with anything else, ie transportation, utilities, groceries...  cancercare.org also had links to other non-profit assistance...
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Oct 14, 2009 01:57PM DiDiT wrote: Polly, I had # 5 of 12 yesterday - I can't remember, did you already have surgery?   I feel pretty good on the Taxol/Herceptin - just have to figure out week to week if it's going to be constipation or diarrhea, so I know which otc to take - if I don't need either of those, I'm only taking prilosec daily and advil pm most of the week so I can sleep.  I also asked for some lasix this week, as last I felt like a bloated pig - in addition to the steroid puff, had swelling hands, feet,even my head!   We'll see how this works.   Is Living Proof in theatres?

Pam/Vickie - I'll be having bilat mx with te's too - so, looking forward to hear 'all the details' good and bad from Vickie and Michelle  -  I guess I'm a planner - and I don't like surprises, want to be fully prepared! Vickie - when did you start having trouble w/taxol?  How long between your last dose of taxol and surgery?   I have to wait 2 1/2 weeks for surgery (that's when they said they could get it scheduled)   I'm her2nu+ and am a little paranoid that as soon as I stop the herceptin, that those cells will start feasting!! Posts.Content: Nov 9, 2009 10:41AM DiDiT wrote: Can we tan?  I'm sure if I asked, they'd probably say no, but when all of this started, it was the end of June, and we were ready to go on vacation - the onc and chemo nurses were emphatic that I'd be 'sun sensitive' and to stay in the shade, wear sunscreen, yada yada yada, which at first, I did - then - I found someone on this site, from Texas who also has a pool who said, she continued to wear sun screen but really didn't notice any 'extra sensitivity'.    I actually was in the pool and at the Lake the very week my port was put in - I just covered it with a water proof dressing - also covered the scar after dressing came off when I was out in the sun. Was really careful after chemo started, until I realized, it really, for me, wasn't making any difference.  I was really in the sun all summer  - spent two weeks at the beach in FL between my 2nd and 3rd AC txs - I did over do a little then - got a mild case of sun poisoning - which I'm prone too anyway. So, as far as the tanning bed, I figure it's kinda the same thing...I don't know if Taxol is any different, but I was in there 10 minutes and it really didn't do anything, so I'm gonna get in a couple times this week... I'm planning on pool exercise at the fitness club and don't want to 'go public' in a swim suit anyway, so maybe a little color will help (it'll make me feel better anyway) So, take that for what it is...I doubt that any doctor would ever 'bless' tanning beds, especially now -   About the head - I kinda forgot, I actually got in there this summer trying to 'tan my head' - I too had used self tanner, but didn't like that my sheets 'got the tan' with the night sweats!! I have some hair now, so I didn't cover my head  (:-)

My ps said she'll use the alloderm graft for the lower portion of the pocket, explained that there's not enough muscle to fully 'engulf' or cover the entire area for the te and or implant.  said that this often prevents movement of said te / imlant - there's a research article that further indicates also may reduce or prevent capsular contraction in radiation pts.  (I'm so hoping!!!) Good Luck Vickie with surgery!!!!    Joanie10 - I'm hearing from my onc and chemo nurses that the weekly taxol is so much more tolerable than every 3 wk tx as dose is lower.  Not sure how they decide which way to treat?  I feel kinda guilty that I'm feeling so well.  Thoroughly enjoy you spa break - it sounds wonderful.  That's the downside of weekly treatment...very difficult to plan 'getaways' - before you know it, you're back in the chair...BUT ONLY 4 MORE TO GO!!!  That reminds me, I need to update my info below... Posts.Content: Nov 11, 2009 09:39AM DiDiT wrote: Pam, I will finish chemo Dec 1 - I thought I was ahead of the game, called back in Sept. to make appt with bs, ps, ob, & rad onc.  Saw them first week in October and gave them dates.  Told them my onc suggested surgery 2-3 wks after chemo, but not any later. My preference was 2 wks.  They (bs & ps) said that would be no prob, as it was early and schedule open. However, by the time the 'coordinator' called me to schedule for Dec 14th, she didn't realize I need bs & ps so she had to go back to 'coordinate' and by the time she got back to me, my date was gone and she was trying to push me back to the end of Dec or Jan 1st - I was not happy, and let her know it.     I guess you could say, we compromised, she got me in on the 18th of December... So, be assertive, plan ahead and get what you want.....and what YOU NEED.  Not at their convenience...:)  The longer it takes for you to get an appt, the further back you may be on surgery schedule..   Actually the girl they scheduled on my date, the 14th came in after I did, with a sob story that she had family coming to take care of her and that was the only week they could come.  I, like I said, was a little bitchy and told her I was there first, and had they bothered to see what my circumstances were?   I of course, felt bad all day for being crabby, and called and apologized...anyway, we all gotta vent some time!   Good Luck! Di Di

Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jun 30, 2009 10:41PM DiDiT wrote: Hi Sea!  similar situation here, I actually haven't cried - been too busy!  PA told me cancer too before biopsy, was not, like everyone else expecting that - I had no significant risk factors.  The biopsy results determined the treatment regimen.  Was diagnosed - or told I had Cancer 3 weeks ago today, biopsy that Friday, results following Monday, Port inserted Tuesday,wig shopping with whole family on Wed - I am 45 and have 3 children - we actually had much fun with this -  PET scan on Thurs - PET results on Friday and chemo started that Friday, and by the Grace of God, so far am feeling fine.  The anxiety, the wait, and the fear of the unknown that first week were tough for both me and my husband.  Feel much better knowing what we're dealing with and what the plan is!
Posts.Title: When do I cry? seaofhope one-L

Posts.Content: Oct 7, 2009 01:44AM DiDiT wrote: gillyone and Pam - thanks for the tips!  I'm using a modified magic mouthwash - I just mixed liquid benedryl with maalox (so, I don't have the lidocaine)  my chemo nurse said rubbing a little orajel topically will do the same thing - so far I only have one sore, we'll see. Taste with AC wasn't so much the problem as  it seems I really never knew what I wanted until I was hungry then needed it right away. Many things didn't sound good - I  ate grilled cheese, soup, mild pasta dishes- kinda weird stuff for me... Anyway, like you Pam, I'm gaining weight!  I'm eating too much of 'what I want'  I'm loving sweets, ice cream, dessert all the time - and soda  and I am (was) not a soda drinker!  I've been kinda celebrating about feeling like eating, but I think I better get serious about getting back to my healthy eating habits, I really don't want to be fat on top of all this!!

Posts.Title: New Comer AsiaYM victoriasecret

Posts.Content: Jul 27, 2009 10:49PM DiDiT wrote: Hi Karen! I just returned from your beautiful part of the country! Dx'd in June, that day, surgeon told me he didn't want me going to Florida in July. Well, oncologist disagreed, minimal se from chemo - had second dose of AC before going to Navarre Beach for 2 weeks - logged too many hours in the sun and got a little sun poison which put me under the umbrella for the last 5 days, but all things considered, grateful was able to go! Was curious about your tx plan...are you doing chemo then surgery then more chemo? My surgeon recommended this (I think surgeons just want to do surgery), but my oncologist recommended that chemo be completed prior to surgery. For one thing, said hair would start growing back and then fall out again - which would be kind of a bummer. She also said that the goal of chemo is to downstage the cancer before surgery - and that there are cells that may not be detected, that there'd be better chance of 'getting' it - also lymph node involvement dtermines radiation therapy recommendations - I guess the more chemo the better? I'm still very early in the tx too - having third dose of chemo this Friday - This site has been a God send for me as I'm sure it already has been for you too. It does seem apparent that everyone's responses and experiences are unique, but for me, thus far, chemo hasn't been bad. Sure they'll be days ahead form the cumulative effect. I am curious about your surgery, please let me know - and I'm envious of your proximity to the BEACH! Di Di
Posts.Title: New Comer AsiaYM victoriasecret

Posts.Content: Jul 30, 2009 08:04PM DiDiT wrote: Karen - Thanks for the reply, I'll check that book out!  Any information appreciated!!  I'm comfortable with my oncologist and trust her judgement, but this whole thing has been happening so fast since diagnosis.  I don't want to miss anything.  If there's 'something out there' that I should be considering, I want to continue to ask questions...Glad that you're responding so well to chemo, continued best wishes.  Will keep in touch!   Thanks Again!   Di Di
Posts.Title: New Comer AsiaYM victoriasecret

Posts.Content: Oct 5, 2009 11:13PM DiDiT wrote: Ladies!  So many of you finishing chemo!  I started in June (stumbled onto your thread this eve searching for mouth sore tx - one popped up yesterday) and won't be finished until December 1st! Congrats to all of you and if you don't mind, I may hang around to follow your progress as I'll be behind many of you with surgery and radiation... have second opinion this Thurs as I'm wanting TE's at time of MX and my surgeon says NO.   My main concern was whether chest wall radiation would be as effective with TE in place - seems to be variety of opinions there!  Hoping someone will have good answer for me - one that I trust! Di Di
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in July 2009 PauldingMom jacee

Posts.Content: Oct 5, 2009 10:41PM DiDiT wrote: Edie - I'm getting taxol weekly x 12 weeks (following AC every 3 wks for 4 treatments) - The weekly taxol is not bad.  Supposedly the every three weeks is much harder, as is higher dose - my cousin said she found that to be harder for her than the AC - but everyone is different!   My 4th treatment is tomorrow and now that I've figured out treating the side effects, not a bad week at all! I need Miralax starting day of chemo for about 4 days, Prilosec every day (Indigestion was bad for me), and Advil PM to help me sleep.  I feel pretty normal now, eating just about anything - actually - just about EVERYTHING!  and energy level is pretty good!! Good Luck!! Di Di
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in July 2009 PauldingMom jacee
